page.title: 10HEALTH AND WELFARE
page.content: There is a surgery with three doctors, one of whom is resident, in the area. Services available include dispensing, ante-natal care, a District Nurse, a Health Visitor, mini-diabetic clinic, coronorary prevention clinic, immunisation clinic, a children's clinic (twice monthly), a contraceptive service and a 'phone-in advice service. There are two Nursing Homes in Kingsland, both under the same management. Home help services and "Meals on Wheels" (hot meals transported to homes) are available for the elderly and infirm. There is a Fire Brigade, started privately in 1893, which is now under the County Brigade. It has 8 Retained Firemen in other jobs, summoned by pocket "bleeper".
